intro: Campium lonchophorum, commonly known as the narrowleaf campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and pinks. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive central stamen, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Campium lonchophorum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
